alert.note: Alert for Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 8:20PM CDT until June 03 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Jones and Shackelford. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 818 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms have moved out of the area. However, runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is likely and there is the potential for flooded low water crossings. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abilene, Anson, Hamlin, Lueders, Nugent, Avoca, Neinda, Funston, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Farm Road 600, Big Country Baptist Assembly and The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 212 crossing California Creek, County Road 245 crossing California Creek, County Road 242 crossing Flag Branch, County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek, County Road 261 crossing Cottonwood Creek and County Road 209 crossing Post Oak Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
